ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The teachers shared with us their practical experiences throughout a lifetime of conservation. I also found all of the tools very helpful.
Applicability for careers and hands-on nature.
The best aspect about this course is that it is real. The conservation cases they share in class very real and inspiring.

The instructors are excellent. It is so valuable to learn from practitioners with so much experience in the conservation field. Apart from just teaching the tools, the instructors add context and stories from their experience that helps illustrate in which settings the tools may be useful or not.
Amy and bills professional experience is invaluable.

I liked that the professors encouraged us to "bend" the tools to adapt them to our projects in cases where they didn't fit very well, therefore allowing us to be creative and to really own our projects

The combination of in-class and out-of-class exercises was fantastic. The homework really adds to the educational experience (unlike many other classes) and the ability to spend the whole semester fleshing out aspects of your final project with constant feedback from Amy is really, really helpful.
Tools learned are extremely practical and I will definitely be able to apply them in my future career.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think a field trip or two would make it even more interesting.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Discussions were great - helped to throw ideas around and get feedback from students and professors. I really like doing the in class exercises in groups.
It is very effective.
Yes very effective

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in possibly pursuing a career in conservation and this class was very helpful.
Filled a niche not filled by other FES courses: how to manage a project. Applicable even if you are not studying "conservation" per se.
I hope to have a career in conservation and the tools we learnt in this class can be very helpful.
I will directly apply the lessons of this course to my summer internship edperience
I aspire to become a conservation practitioner and this course taught me the practical tools that I can use to conceptualize, implement and monitor a conservation project.

Although I don't study conservation strictly, I took this class because understanding how conservation projects are structured and implemented is highly relevant to anyone working in the environmental field and because the tools learned in this class can be applied to any kind of project management, not just conservation.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I want to learn more about conservation and the tools necessary to be successful in this field!
I wanted the project management skills.
I want to use the tools to analyze our conservation goals , strategies and targets.
I wanted a course that will give me skills needed for a field conservationist.
Best class at F&ES! Most practical, suits my personality & top notch professors with real-world experience.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes. Would have liked more info on budgets and fitting projects within a larger program.
Yes , it did.
Yes.
Yes
Yes! Very practical skills
Yes! Or even exceeded my expectations. It was the most useful skills/tools-based class that I took at FES.
Yes, and beyond!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We built off of each others' ideas and worked together to create a quality final product.
Helpful to discuss concepts with others.
It was very helpful to have class time in groups to review our conceptual models and the various tools to receive feedback from our peers.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Update all of your tools throughout the semester as the teachers give you feedback so that you are not rushing at the end to put together your final submission!
Worth your while!
It is a great class if you are interested in conservation works. It is very REAL and PRACTICAL.
I highly recommend this course for students interested in conservation work.
Definitely take it! This class will make you feel like you own your project like no other class!

Amy (and Bill) might be the best instructor at F&ES, able to weave their earlier academic experience into their extensive field and practitioner experience to create a class that is highly relevant for everyone studying environmental management. Though the class focuses on conservation, it's relevant for anyone who expects to be managing environmental projects. Take it!
This class is a MUST if you plan to work in conservation.
